analyzed: nus pa la ling 'ang ngo //

analyzed: zhus pa rtogs par byed pa la ling 'gyur zhing krita sogs kyi rkyen 'ang (rtsva lhas gyis shig/) 'gyur te /

analyzed: tvam bh'a ram ba he:/ sa mutstsha ye& n+ya ta ra sy'am /

analyzed: sa mutsatsha ye s'a m'a n+ya ba tsa na sya /

original: tshogs pa mnyam par brjod pa'i 'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa mnyam par brjod pa'i 'o //

analyzed: tshogs (khyod la khur 'os/) pa mnyam par brjod pa rtogs par byed pa la'ang lot 'gyur zhing gzhan yang lat sogs mang po 'gyur te /

analyzed: (lot)...y'a hi / (lat)...a'a ta / (lung)...aa y'a s'it /

original: (lrit)...y'a sya ti /
analyzed: (lrit)...y'a sya ti /
translated: Lat is added to the root i, giving i.

analyzed: 'grel bar / gnyis gnyis bldabs pa sogs lot mi 'jug pa rnams la lat sbyor ro zhes byung bas /

original: pu na pu na:pi ba ti /
analyzed: pu na pu na:pi ba ti /

original: pu na pu na:kh'a da ti /
analyzed: pu na pu na:kh'a da ti /

original: pu na pu na sva sti /
analyzed: pu na pu na sva sti /

analyzed: sogs so // ai ti p'a ni ni by'a ga ra na sya s'u tr'ata (thob par shog / thob par byed /

original: thob zin / thob par 'gyur/) k'a l'artha bart'a:sa m'apt'a:/
analyzed: thob zin / thob par 'gyur/) k'a l'artha bart'a:sa m'apt'a:/

original: zhes pa p'a ni ni by'a kar na'i mdo las dus kyi don gyi 'jug pa rnams rdzogs (slar nas slar 'thung bar byed /
analyzed: zhes pa p'a ni ni by'a kar na'i mdo las dus kyi don gyi 'jug pa rnams rdzogs (slar nas slar 'thung bar byed /
translated: Thus, the engagement of the meaning of time in the sūtra of Pāṇini is complete.

original: slar nas slar bza' bar byed /
analyzed: slar nas slar bza' bar byed /
translated: Again and again, one drinks.🔽Again and again, one eats.

original: slar yang slang yang bde legs su gyur cig/) so /🔽// / de rnams kyis brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po p'a ni ni by'a kar na gzhung 'grel gyi go don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba las lat sogs 'das ma 'ongs da ltar
analyzed: slar yang slang yang bde legs su gyur cig/) so / // / de rnams kyis brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po p'a ni ni by'a kar na gzhung 'grel gyi go don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba las lat sogs 'das ma 'ongs da ltar
translated: Again and again, may there be well-being.

original: ba sogs kyi dus kyi khyad par gyi don la 'jug yul rags pa rnams bshad zin te /
analyzed: ba sogs kyi dus kyi khyad par gyi don la 'jug yul rags pa rnams bshad zin te /
translated: Thus, in the Chariot that Leads to the Jewel of Eloquence, which is a record of the meaning of the great treatise on grammar, the Pāṇini Vyākaraṇa, along with the commentary, examples of usage, and so on, the rough objects of engagement of the meaning of time, such as the past, future, and present, have been explained.

original: 'grel par ji skad du /
analyzed: 'grel par ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in the commentary:

original: dh'a t'u n'a ma nanta tv'atstsa n'a n'artha tv'atsatsa sarba th'a /🔽aa pi dh'a tu ma sha kya mi tya la m'a khy'a ta khy'a pa ne /
analyzed: dh'a t'u n'a ma nanta tv'atstsa n'a n'artha tv'atsatsa sarba th'a / aa pi dh'a tu ma sha kya mi tya la m'a khy'a ta khy'a pa ne /
translated: The root text says: The dhātus are infinite, and the tva-c-nas are the meaning of all.🔽Even the dhātus are not able to be like that, and so on.

original: byings rnams kyang ni mtha' yas nyid //
analyzed: byings rnams kyang ni mtha' yas nyid //
translated: The roots are also infinite.

original: sna tshogs don nyid thams cad du //
analyzed: sna tshogs don nyid thams cad du //
translated: In all cases, they have various meanings.

original: byings rnams mngon gsal nus ji bzhin //
analyzed: byings rnams mngon gsal nus ji bzhin //
translated: The roots are clearly able to do that.

original: kun bshad rdzogs par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: kun bshad rdzogs par bshad pa'o //
translated: The complete explanation is the full explanation.

original: zhes kyang byung bas /
analyzed: zhes kyang byung bas /
translated: This is also stated.

original: byings re res don mang po dang / byings mang po don re re la 'jug pa sogs mtha' yas la /🔽de @421a * //
analyzed: byings re res don mang po dang / byings mang po don re re la 'jug pa sogs mtha' yas la / de @421a * //
translated: Each root has many meanings, and many roots are used for each meaning, and so on, infinitely.

original: rnams kyi don gsal bar brjod dgos pa rnams rang gi nus pa dang 'tsham pa kun nas bshad pa'i don rnams tshang bar bshad zin no zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rnams kyi don gsal bar brjod dgos pa rnams rang gi nus pa dang 'tsham pa kun nas bshad pa'i don rnams tshang bar bshad zin no zhes pa ste /
translated: The meanings of those that need to be clearly stated are fully explained in accordance with their ability, and the meaning of the complete explanation is finished.

original: de ltar brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po p'a ni ni by'a kar na'i mdo slob dpon chen po r'a ma tsandras mdzad pa'i 'grel pa dang bcas pa'i go don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes🔽bya ba las /
analyzed: de ltar brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po p'a ni ni by'a kar na'i mdo slob dpon chen po r'a ma tsandras mdzad pa'i 'grel pa dang bcas pa'i go don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba las /
translated: This is called “The Chariot That Guides the Jewel of Good Explanation.”

original: lat sogs sde tshan bcu bam ti sogs brgya brgyad cu ste rnam dbye sde tshan phyi ma rnams byings la sbyor tshul sogs zhib mor bstan pa kun bshad pa'i rab tu bya ba rnams re zhig rdzogs so /
analyzed: lat sogs sde tshan bcu bam ti sogs brgya brgyad cu ste rnam dbye sde tshan phyi ma rnams byings la sbyor tshul sogs zhib mor bstan pa kun bshad pa'i rab tu bya ba rnams re zhig rdzogs so /
translated: The section on the latter case endings, the ten sections such as la, and the eighty-one sections such as baṃ, including the detailed presentation of the method of applying the case endings to the verbal roots, the complete explanation, is finished for the time being.

original: // / # //  bla ma dang chos skyong srung ma'i tshogs la sgo gsum gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: // / # //  bla ma dang chos skyong srung ma'i tshogs la sgo gsum gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I respectfully pay homage with my three doors to the assembly of gurus and Dharma protectors.

original: de ltar byings tshig tu bsgrub pa kun nas bshad pa'i cho ga rnams bstan zin nas /
analyzed: de ltar byings tshig tu bsgrub pa kun nas bshad pa'i cho ga rnams bstan zin nas /
translated: Having explained the rules for the complete presentation of the verbal roots,

original: da ni byings ming du bsgrub pa'i rkyen krita la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jug yul cho ga dper brjod sogs bshad par bya ste ;
analyzed: da ni byings ming du bsgrub pa'i rkyen krita la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jug yul cho ga dper brjod sogs bshad par bya ste ;

original: dh'a to:/ byings las so //
analyzed: dh'a to:/ byings las so //
translated: From a verbal root.

original: 'chad 'gyur krita sogs kyi rkyen ta bya la sogs pa 'di rnams byings las pha rol tu 'gyur te byings ming du bsgrub pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad 'gyur krita sogs kyi rkyen ta bya la sogs pa 'di rnams byings las pha rol tu 'gyur te byings ming du bsgrub pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: These conditions ta and so on, which are explained below, are applied to a verbal root, and they are called conditions that establish a verbal root as a noun.

original: ta tro pa pa dam sabta m'istham /
analyzed: ta tro pa pa dam sabta m'istham /
translated: tatropasargaḥ svanmatastamaḥ.

original: de la bdun pa gnas pa nye ba'i tshig go //
